Manx: 23 jeh yn vee S’jerree jeh’n vlein

English: “Very Merry Christmas and happy new year and many of them.
Manx: Bea as slaynt Ollick vie ghennal as blein vie noa as ymmoddee jeu.

English: I hope you may be spared for a longtime to put forward and preserve the old manx language.
Manx: Treishteil dy bee shiu sparit son foddey liauyr dy hraa dy cur er y hoshiaght, as dy reayl seose shenn glare Ellan Vannin

English: I am also wishing that the almighty protector may defend you from all harm and danger.
Manx: Ta mee myrgeddyn treishteil dy jean yn Fer Choadee ooilley-niartal shiu y endeil as y reayl voish dy chooilly assee as danjeyr.

English: May he clothe you in grace, that is proper and kind.
Manx: Dy jean E shiu y coamrey lesh dy chooilley grayse ta cooie as dooie.

English: And may he lead your steps in the path of peace.
Manx: As dy jean E leeideil nyn kesmaydyn ayns ny cassanyn dy hee.

English: As in the end you will be counted worthy
Manx: Myr ee yn jerrey dy bee shiu coontit feeu

English: to take part in the everlasting life, a place without any Christmas, or new years, and years without extent, and days not spent.
Manx: dy goaill ayrn ayns eiraght yn vea-veayn, boayl nagh vel ollick erbee arragh, ny blein noa, as blein nagh vel roshtyn, as laa nagh vel ceau.

English: Here the greatest desire of him is to be counted worthy to be called your friend and your servant"
Manx: Shoh yn ard-yeearree eshyn ta coondey eh smoo feeu dy ve ynmysit nyn carrey, as nyn shirveishagh.
